sections.heading: Short title.
sections.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Interstate Library Compact Act.

sections.heading: Administrator.
sections.text:
The Secretary of State, ex officio, shall be the compact administrator.
The compact administrator shall receive copies of all agreements entered
into by the state or its political subdivisions and other states or
political subdivisions; consult with, advise and aid such governmental
units in the formulation of such agreements; make such recommendations to
the governor, legislature, governmental agencies and units as he deems
desirable to effectuate the purposes of this compact and consult and
co-operate with the compact administrators of other party states.

sections.heading: The compact administrator and the library board of any county,
sections.text:
city, village or incorporated town, township, library district or library
system are authorized and empowered to enter into agreements with other
states or their political subdivisions pursuant to the compact. Such
agreements as may be made pursuant to this compact on behalf of the state
of Illinois shall be made by the compact administrator. Such agreements as
may be made on behalf of a political subdivision shall be made after due
notice to the compact administrator and consultation with him.

sections.heading: The agencies and officers of this state and its subdivisions
sections.text:
shall enforce this compact and do all things appropriate to effect its
purpose and intent which may be within their respective jurisdiction.
